intro: Rinorea oblanceolata, commonly known as the broadleaf rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Rinorea oblanceolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
